Event.name: Precipitation
Event.definition:
<def-root>Water in some solid or liquid form (the <fen>Precipitation</fen>) falls from the sky at a particular <fen>Place</fen> and <fen>Time</fen>, lasting for a particular <fen>Duration</fen>. The <fen>Rate</fen> or <fen>Quantity</fen> of precipitation may also be indicated.
<ex>It <t>rained</t> <fex name="Place">in Berkeley</fex> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Precipitation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The water in liquid or solid form that falls from the sky is the Precipitation. This FE is incorporated in many LUs in this frame.</def-root>

Arg.name: Rate
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Quantity of Precipitation that falls within a certain Duration. <ex>It <t>rains</t> <fex name="Rate">only half an inch per year</fex> around here.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Quantity
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Quantity is the amount of Precipitation that has fallen in a precipitation event or events. It is usually measured as the height that the Precipitation attains if prevented from further movement. <ex>It <t>rained</t> <fex name="Quantity">six inches</fex> last night.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which the precipitation event lasts.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>When the event occurs. <ex>It will probably be <t>raining</t> <fex name="Time">at five o'clock</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> is the reason for the precipitation event. <ex>It <t>rains</t> <fex name="Explanation">because of high humidity</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The way in which the precipitation falls. <ex>It <t>drizzled</t> <fex name="Manner">softly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Temperature
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the temperature of the precipitation. <ex>I was standing in the <fex name="Temperature">cool</fex> <t>drizzle</t>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: rain.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the condensed moisture of the atmosphere falling visibly in separate drops.

lexUnit.name: rain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: rain falls.

lexUnit.name: rain event.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the overall event (e.g., storm) in which rain is falling to the ground

lexUnit.name: snow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: snow falls.

lexUnit.name: snow.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: atmospheric water vapour frozen into ice crystals and falling in light white flakes or lying on the ground as a white layer.

lexUnit.name: snowfall.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fall of snow.

lexUnit.name: rainfall.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the fall of rain.

lexUnit.name: drizzle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: rain lightly.

lexUnit.name: drizzle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: light rain falling in very fine drops.

lexUnit.name: sleet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sleet falls.

lexUnit.name: sleet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: rain containing some ice, or snow melting as it falls.

lexUnit.name: downpour.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a heavy fall of rain.

lexUnit.name: hail.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pellets of frozen rain falling in showers from cumulonimbus clouds.

lexUnit.name: hail.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hail falls.

lexUnit.name: precipitation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: rain, snow, sleet, or hail that falls to or condenses on the ground.

lexUnit.name: precipitation [event].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the overall event (e.g., storm) in which rain, snow, sleet, or hail is falling to the ground

lexUnit.name: shower.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a brief and usually light fall of rain or snow.

lexUnit.name: torrent.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strong and fast-moving stream of water or other liquid

lexUnit.name: sprinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: rain very lightly.

lexUnit.name: torrential.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: strong, plentiful and fast-moving, as a torrent

lexUnit.name: shower.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: rain briefly and lightly

lexUnit.name: snow [event].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the overall event in which snow falls from the sky
